title: 2025 Indian Wells prize money
description: Holger Rune and Jack Draper are set to battle in Sunday's final of the BNP Paribas Open, with the winner set to walk away with more than $1 million. The champion will receive $1,201,125, with the runner-up collecting $638,750 from an overall prize pool will of US$9,693,540. View the full prize-money breakdown and the PIF ATP Rankings points at stake below. 2025 Indian Wells Singles Prize Money Round   Points   Prize Money  Champion  1000  $1,201,125  Finalist  650  $638,750  Semi-finalist  400  $354,850  Quarter-finalist  200  $202,000  R16  100  $110,250  R32  50  $64,500  Second Round  30  $37,650  First Round  10  $25,375 2025 Indian Wells Doubles Prize Money (per team)  Round  Points  Prize Money  Champion  1000  $457,150  Finalist  600  $242,020  Semi-finalist  360  $129,970  Quarter-finalist  180  $65,000  Second Round  90  $34,850  First Round  0  $19,050 [NEWSLETTER FORM]
excerpt: The BNP Paribas Open has released its prize money breakdown for the 2025 edition of the ATP 1000 event in Indian Wells, California. The prize pool will be USD $9,693,540.
text: Tournament News View round-by-round breakdown March 16, 2025 Matthew Stockman/Getty Images The 2025 BNP Paribas Open will be held from 5-16 March. By ATP Staff Holger Rune and Jack Draper are set to battle in Sunday's final of the BNP Paribas Open, with the winner set to walk away with more than $1 million. The champion will receive $1,201,125, with the runner-up collecting $638,750 from an overall prize pool will of US$9,693,540. View the full prize-money breakdown and the PIF ATP Rankings points at stake below. 2025 Indian Wells Singles Prize Money Round   Points   Prize Money  Champion  1000  $1,201,125  Finalist  650  $638,750  Semi-finalist  400  $354,850  Quarter-finalist  200  $202,000  R16  100  $110,250  R32  50  $64,500  Second Round  30  $37,650  First Round  10  $25,375 2025 Indian Wells Doubles Prize Money (per team)  Round  Points  Prize Money  Champion  1000  $457,150  Finalist  600  $242,020  Semi-finalist  360  $129,970  Quarter-finalist  180  $65,000  Second Round  90  $34,850  First Round  0  $19,050
html:
Tournament News

View round-by-round breakdown

March 16, 2025

Matthew Stockman/Getty Images

The 2025 BNP Paribas Open will be held from 5-16 March. By ATP Staff

Holger Rune and Jack Draper are set to battle in Sunday's final of the BNP Paribas Open, with the winner set to walk away with more than $1 million.

The champion will receive $1,201,125, with the runner-up collecting $638,750 from an overall prize pool will of US$9,693,540.

View the full prize-money breakdown and the PIF ATP Rankings points at stake below.

2025 Indian Wells Singles Prize Money

Round   Points   Prize Money
 Champion  1000  $1,201,125
 Finalist  650  $638,750
 Semi-finalist  400  $354,850
 Quarter-finalist  200  $202,000
 R16  100  $110,250
 R32  50  $64,500
 Second Round  30  $37,650
 First Round  10  $25,375

2025 Indian Wells Doubles Prize Money (per team)

 Round  Points  Prize Money
 Champion  1000  $457,150
 Finalist  600  $242,020
 Semi-finalist  360  $129,970
 Quarter-finalist  180  $65,000
 Second Round  90  $34,850
 First Round  0  $19,050
